intro: Monocera multiflora, commonly known as the multiflora monocera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Solanaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Monocera multiflora is native to certain regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
